definitions.definition: ( rhetoric ) The repetition of a phrase at the beginning of phrases, sentences , or verses , used for emphasis .
( linguistics ) An expression that refers to a preceding expression.
( Christianity ) The most solemn part of the Divine Liturgy or the Mass during which the offerings of bread and wine are consecrated as body and blood of Christ .

main_definition: ( rhetoric ) The repetition of a phrase at the beginning of phrases, sentences , or verses , used for emphasis .
